classes.cCustomNote: Any free elective can go here. Majors must demonstrate intermediate-level proficiency in a foreign language. Any language classes needed before intermediate level will count as free electives.
Choose one of the following: ENG133, ENGL134.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B1, B2, B3, (B4 [lab] must be completed with either B2 or B3), B1-B5 elective, C2, C3, C4, D1, D2, D3, D4, D5, and F. C4, D5, and F should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Two (2) courses must be completed in B1. Upper Division C4 must be satisfied by taking a non-English course. Refer to online catalog for GE course selection and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR).

Any ENGL Elective (300-Level) can go here. See catalog for Upper Division courses. English majors are encouraged to use their upper-division ENGL electives to pursue their interests, including literature, creative writing, linguistics, and/or rhetoric and writing. Minimum 12 units in literature.
